subject: Re: Dynamically discovering classes in a package. (was: Re: [junit] Why is it considered an error if there is no test in the file?)
msgSnippet: Thank you, that gave me some yes, but of course moments :) Very interesting! ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
Thank you, that gave me some "yes, but of course" moments :) Very
interesting!

On 11/9/06, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
>
> org.testng.internal.PackageUtils#findClassesInPackage
>
> /**
> * @param packageName
> * @return The list of all the classes inside this package
> * @throws IOException
> */
> public static String[] findClassesInPackage(String packageName,
> List<String> included, List<String> excluded)
>
> --
> Cedric
>
> On 11/9/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...<joakim.ohlrogge%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> >
> > That sounds interesting! Could you point me to the code? A classname or
> > package?
> >
> >
> > On 11/9/06, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@... <cbeust%40google.com>>
> wrote:
> > >
> > > David,
> > >
> > > On 11/9/06, David Saff <saff@... <saff%40mit.edu><saff%40mit.edu>> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > The ability to, with even just 80% reliability, get at runtime all
> of
> > > the
> > > > classes in a package, without having to parse directories of source
> > > code,
> > > > would be great for JUnit and other packages. Of course, Java makes
> > 100%
> > > > reliability impossible, but it would seem that examining the
> classpath
> > > > could
> > > > allow some magic to be worked. It would also seem the kind of
> problem
> > > > that
> > > > someone out there may have already solved. Anyone have a pointer?
> > >
> > > TestNG has code that does that (you can basically specify 'run all the
> > > classes in the package "com.foo.mytests"', and we even support
> > wildcards).
> > > Not sure where your 80% figure comes from, because I can promise you
> it
> > > works 100% of the time (even though it relies on a few things that are
> > > only
> > > loosely documented in the ClassLoader API).
> > >
> > > Feel free to grab the code.
> > >
> > > --
> > > Cédric
